Package com.sda8.financetracker.ui

Class Columns

java.lang.Object
com.sda8.financetracker.ui.Columns
public class Columns
extends java.lang.Object
The Columns class generates tables by evenly spacing passed strings in a row format. Each following row needs to have an equal amount of string variables as the initial row. Spacing will be auto generated to expand and contract column widths as required. Once all rows have been appended, a toString method will print the rows with evenly spaced columns.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructor Description
    Columns()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addLine​(java.lang.String... line)
    Creates a single row by appending multiple strings together.
    void print()
    Prints all rows with evenly spaced columns.
    java.lang.String toString()
    Spaces each column to the required width based on the widest row item of all the row items sharing the same index location.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Columns

      public Columns()

  • Method Details

    • addLine

      public void addLine​(java.lang.String... line)
      Creates a single row by appending multiple strings together. The row needs to have the same number of string elements as previous rows to avoid formatting issues.
      Parameters:
      line - multiple String elements to be placed in a row.

    • print

      public void print()
      Prints all rows with evenly spaced columns.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Spaces each column to the required width based on the widest row item of all the row items sharing the same index location. After spacing the rows are appended to a string builder and the complete table is returned in String format.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      completed table in string format after padding is applied.
